These cantons are known as half-cantons and are thus represented by only one councillor (instead of two) in the Council of States.   The cantons have a permanent constitutional status and, in comparison with the situation in other countries, a high degree of independence. Under the Federal Constitution, all 26 cantons are equal in status. Each canton has its own constitution, and its own parliament, government and courts.  However, there are considerable differences between the individual cantons, most particularly in terms of population and geographical area.
